ygData.subject: Re: Re: lvl 29 pet spell
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Murphy, Kenneth E.  To:  Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 2:36 PM Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Re: lvl
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Murphy, Kenneth E. <MurphyK@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 2:36 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Re: lvl 29 pet spell


> From: "Murphy, Kenneth E." <MurphyK@...>
>
> Actually,
>
> My gnome is my lev 18 magician. I took my magician to buy 2 copies of the
> lev 29 pet spell. I then gave the 2 copies to a lev 28 necro friend and
> switched chars back to my necromancer. My friend then game me a copy of
the
> spell and paid for the other one.
>
> It sucks to have to use a character as a mule, but it got the job done
fast.

I really don't see any problem with using a mule in this case, why would
someone who hates Necromancers so much peddle their spells to begin with?
Seems like just a blatant case of "you're evil, we're making life rough on
you" I could see putting it in the middle of nowhere, lvl 29 people should
have to travel a bit for their advanced power...but to put it on something
that's hostile? C'mon!!
